alert.note: Alert for Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 05 at 2:41AM MDT until April 07 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .Snow will develop early Wednesday morning and continue through most of the day. The heaviest snow is expected in the morning, with up to 6 inches possible in the higher elevations above 5500 feet and north facing slopes. Much less snow can be expected at lower elevations with up to 3 inches possible. The snow combined with wind gusts potentially over 60 mph will impact travel, especially in open areas. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM WEDNESDAY TO MIDNIGHT MDT WEDNESDAY NIGHT BELOW 5500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING ABOVE 5500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory below 5500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch above 5500 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills. In South Dakota, the Northern Black Hills and the Central Black Hills. * WHEN...From 3 AM Wednesday to midnight MDT Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. A Winter Storm Watch means heavy snow, strong winds, freezing precipitation, and cold temperatures are possible. Monitor NOAA weather radio, local radio or television, or the Internet for updates on this potentially dangerous storm. Take time to prepare for severe winter conditions before the storm develops. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
